data.title: Prof. Lifshitz
data.text:
Prof. Efrat Lifshitz is a full professor and dean at the Schulich Faculty of Chemistry, Technion–Israel Institute of Technology, Haifa. She earned her Ph.D. at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Michigan, USA. She did postdoctoral research at the University of Michigan and the Weizmann Institute of Science, Rehovot, Israel. She joined the Technion–Israel Institute of Technology in 1990. Prof. Lifshitz currently holds the Matwei Gunsbuourgh Academic Chair at the Schulich Faculty of Chemistry, Technion. She is the recipient of numerous prizes, the most recent among them: The Taub Excellent in Research Prize (2019); Lectureship speaker, Bilkent University, Ankara, Turkey,

(2018); Lectureship speaker, ETH, Switzerland, (2016); Israel Vacuum Society Excellence Award for Research (2016); UK-Israel Lectureship Award, Oxford University (2015); Tenne Family Prize in memory of Lea Tenne for Nanoscale Sciences, awarded by the Israel Chemical Society (2015); External Senior Fellow at the Freiburg Institute of Advanced Studies (2015). Prof. Lifshitz has published ~ 220 scientific publications in journals with high-ranking peer review, including ACS Nano, Nano Letters, Adv. Mater., PRL, PRB; invited reviews (e.g., Science 2016, Nanoscale 2016, Adv. Func. Matt. 2018); reviewed proceedings; and book chapters. She has delivered approximately 150 invited talks at top-tier international scientific meetings (for example, MRS, E-MRS, TNT, nanoGe, GRC, QD20xx, NaNaX), and her research has been funded by assorted national agency resources, binational programs, and various FP7 and Horizon2020 projects. In addition, she frequently serves on prestigious evaluation committees (ERC Advance and Synergy Grants, Cost, Wolf Prize, Israel Prize, Rothschild Foundation, and binational programs). Prof. Lifshitz has also been an active partner in establishing the Nanotechnology and Renewable Energy Centers at the Technion and has acted as chairman or co-chairman for various national and international scientific meetings. Further details are provided in the attached short CV and the research description.
